title: Am I good at singing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, Anna; What I am able to hear sounds to me that you are able to hold pitch, carry the tune (though I do not listen to Rhiannah’s music), and stay in tune throughout. These are important qualities you need to develop. If you are serious about learning to sing better, at a more “professional” level, or at least a level where you can truly belt out any tune, I would suggest you take singing lessons. If you are working, set aside 20 bucks a week, go bi-weekly to a reputable teacher that comes with high recommendations. Forty bucks a lesson is not terribly expensive. And, yes, you can get lessons for less. But you want a truly good teacher, someone who really knows what is required and knows how to teach it to you. You can try out a number of teachers before you settle on one. Some give free first lessons. But, at the end of the day, keep singing! And, so you understand how this really works: for any given song, you need to find the key that best suits YOUR voice. The Rhiannah song sounded a bit low to me, for your voice. This is based solely upon what you offered. It may not be YOUR key, where you would sing the song best. A good teacher will teach you about this, changing the key to suit YOUR voice. If they don’t encourage you to do that, find another teacher. Good luck! Never quit!

You've got definite potential. I would second what Geoffrey said. You're a little young to be singing music that sits that low, and if you really want to do something with it, a teacher never hurts. Of course, it also depends what your ultimate goal is. Meanwhile, there are things you can do. First of all, before you make a video like this or sing for an audience (not including lessons, that is), make sure to warm up your voice. You sounded much better at the end of the video than a at the beginning because your voice was starting to warm up. Second, make sure you're taking good care of yourself, getting enough sleep, staying hydrated, getting exercise, all that good stuff. Third, you need to make a video of yourself singing where you're not holding a mic in front of your mouth, so you can see what you're doing while you sing. And if it's a video that you intend to be public, try to avoid touching your face during it. And then there's always my favorite go-to source, which is VoiceCouncil Magazine Check it out!

Have you been told you are? Do you feel you are? If the answer is yes then why are you asking me? Do you want to sing around the house? Or to your children? Or do you want to sing in Church, or perhaps professionally? If you wish to try and make money with your voice you should find a vocal coach and work with him or her. Follow her instruction and take his advice. Warning- If your feelings are easily hurt then singing professionally will be very difficult for you. Thanks for asking!

Your voice is nice but requires work with vocal teacher. Also you use your chest register mainly, I hear some metalic sound. That means that may be you can be dramatic soprano in future. But only vocal teacher after a few months of work with you can tell more precise.

Hi, as other people have said it does seem like you have a bit of trouble on the lower registers but overall I thought you were reasonably good. You tend to sing from your neck slightly which is not a good thing, but keep practicing and keep your dreams alive. Kudos for putting it out there.

We all have a level of talent when it comes to singing. We can all learn and advance with practice. It is important to know your limits and learn to push past them and break the comfort zone. As I have not heard you sing I can not comment to what level you are at. Keep learning and progressing. :) It is a joy to sing. X
Pretty sure I answered another question from you about your singing. Same as I said before. Solid voice, keep practicing, work on precision voice control.
If you have to ask, then you have doubt.
